column1: Kirovo-Chepetsk (Russian: Ки́рово-Чепе́цк) is a town in Kirov Oblast
column3: located at the confluence of the Cheptsa and the Vyatka Rivers
column4: 20 kilometers (12 mi) east of Kirov. Population: 80

column1: The 50th eastern meridian runs exactly through the town.
It was founded in the mid-15th century as the village of Ust-Cheptsa (Усть-Чепца). Town status was granted to it in 1955.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Kirovo-Chepetsk serves as the administrative center of Kirovo-Chepetsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the Town of Kirovo-Chepetsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the Town of Kirovo-Chepetsk is incorporated as Kirovo-Chepetsk Urban Okrug.
